  – In the context of the 'Ai Kapu epoch, where social order depended on the maintenance of sacred eating taboos and careful genealogical reckoning, this moment signifies both a climax of martial prowess and a restoration—or even elevation—of sacred order through the female line.

• **Conclusion:**
  – This passage encapsulates an archetypal moment of Hawaiian mo'olelo: through decisive action and adherence to cultural protocols, the protagonist not only conquers but legitimizes and stabilizes his rule by honoring maternal ancestry—a framework vital to the structure and transmission of Hawaiian chiefly authority and tradition.
